definition: pocket/bag/to wrap up or hold in a bag/to move in a circle/to canvas or solicit/to take responsibility for/to disclose in detail/combat armor (old)

sentences.english: The respected Gungan dressed in the formal clothes of a Rep, complete with hood and robes.
sentences.chinese: 这位可敬的冈根人身着配有长袍和兜帽的议事正装。

sentences.english: Holly kicked snow from her boots and lowered the hood of her cloak.
sentences.chinese: 霍丽把她靴子上的雪甩掉，放下了她的兜帽。

sentences.english: Keep your head down and your hood up.
Obi-Wan and Anakin entered, keeping their hoods on.
sentences.chinese: 欧比万和阿纳金走进旅店，但并没有摘下兜帽。

sentences.english: Keep your heads down and your hoods up.
sentences.chinese: 拉上兜帽，低下你们的头。

sentences.english: Drying his wounds, he donned his ankle-length, hooded robe.
sentences.chinese: 擦干了伤口，他穿上了齐踝的长的有兜帽的长袍。

sentences.english: The fifth hooded shape began to writhe atop the wagon.
sentences.chinese: 第五个戴着兜帽的形体，开始在马车上翻滚起来。

sentences.english: Wear the cloak with the hood and keep your head down.
sentences.chinese: 把兜帽斗篷套上然后低下头。

sentences.english: And I see it has a hood.
sentences.chinese: 而且我看见它还有顶兜帽。

sentences.english: He wore his hood low so that it shaded his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他压低兜帽，遮上了眼睛。

definition: face flannel or towel/shroud (over the face of a corpse)
Chinese-style long robe worn as outermost garment/burqa
